hero.headline: Learn Piano the Right Way : From Beginner to Performer in 6 Months
hero.subheadline: Structured. Practical. Performance-based. For all ages.

usps.title: Musician First, Pianist Second
usps.description: We focus on growing you as a complete musician - with theory, ear training, transcription, rhythm, and notation. Piano skills become a natural byproduct of musical understanding.

usps.title: Learn Everything by Ear
usps.description: No memorization. You'll know the sixth of Bb major is G, hear it's a major sixth, and understand how it relates to surrounding notes - all by ear, applied to real songs.

usps.title: Music Factory: Deep Song Analysis
usps.description: Our signature transcription class where you analyze entire songs - notation, chord logic, rhythm structure. You'll understand WHY composers chose each chord, not just WHAT they played.

usps.title: Music Gym: 3D Practice System
usps.description: Dedicated exercises targeting ears, technique, and theory. Structured practice that builds genuine skill, not just muscle memory.

usps.title: Modular Learning Pathways
usps.description: 3-4 lesson modules with clear goals: singing & playing, chord inversions, gospel music, seasonal songs. You always know exactly what you're working toward.

usps.title: Rhythm Theory Included
usps.description: Unlike typical courses, we teach rhythm as theory - a complete system often missing from music education. Learn Konnakol, Afro-Cuban patterns, and complex metres.

usps.title: Graded Certificate Program
usps.description: This is serious music education. Weekly homework, personalized feedback, grading, and exams. For students who want to become musicians, not hobbyists.

usps.title: HD Recordings + Live Notes
usps.description: Every class recorded in HD quality. Plus handwritten notes, notation, supplementary resources, and practice tracks - lesson after lesson.

usps.title: Flexible Time Zones & Scheduling
usps.description: Weekday mornings, evenings after work, or weekend slots. Choose from 32, 40, 50, or 65-hour packages over a 6-month semester that fits your schedule.

pianoSkills.title: Advanced Piano Technique
items: Swara variations with transposition & intervallic motion
Spider exercise for finger independence & chromatic mastery
Exploring thirds (major/minor) across all keys
Pendulum patterns with scale fluency & finger crossing
Highest-note inversions with melodic voicing
Oom-Pah left-hand grooves with agile right-hand melodies

theory.title: Harmony & Advanced Theory
items: Chord shapes using the Circle of Fifths (all 12 keys)
Diatonic seventh chords & all seventh-chord families
Pivot thirds in major, harmonic minor, Dorian & melodic minor
The Mother of All Chord Progressions (diatonic circle)
ii-V-I progressions with block, Latin & arpeggio approaches
Modes: Mixolydian improv with scale-building & plagal cadences

earTraining.title: Ear Training & Transcription
items: Identifying intervals by ear (major/minor sixths, sevenths)
Transcribing melodies, rhythms & chord progressions
Recognizing scales, modes & chord qualities in real songs
Computing harmonic movement & bass lines
Music Factory: complete song analysis & notation

rhythm.title: Rhythm & World Music Patterns
items: Accented arpeggios with irregular groupings & syncopation
Salsa Piano: Tresillo, Claves (3:2, 2:3, Rumba, Bossa)
Building rhythmic phrases with Konnakol (South Indian)
Blues with left-hand Charleston & dominant-7th patterns
Odd metres (7/8, 5/8) & complex accent schemes (3-3-2, 3-3-3-3-4)

classes: 12 Musicianship Classes (Theory, Ear Training, Rhythm, Composition)
features: Live sessions + recordings for every class

faq.question: Do I need my own keyboard?
faq.answer: Yes. You'll need a keyboard or piano at home to practice between lessons. We recommend a full-size (61-88 keys) touch-sensitive keyboard to get the most realistic playing experience. Our team can guide you with recommendations if you're looking to buy one.

faq.question: Is this only for beginners?
faq.answer: Not at all! While the Foundation Course is perfect for beginners, it's also designed for students from Trinity/ABRSM or self-taught musicians who want to build stronger rhythmic, harmonic, and real-world playing skills. Many intermediate players join to "fill the gaps" and strengthen their fundamentals.

faq.question: What if I miss a class?
faq.answer: Every live session is recorded in HD and shared privately with you. You'll also receive assignments and feedback through our system so you never fall behind. You can even review topics anytime using our dedicated Video Courses section on nathanielschool.com.

faq.question: What age group is this for?
faq.answer: We've trained students from age 7 to 75+! The course is structured to adapt to each learner's goals and pace. It's never too early or too late to start learning music.

faq.question: Can I learn from outside India?
faq.answer: Yes! Our classes are time-zone friendly and available live online or in hybrid mode (live + recordings). We have students joining from all over the world, from Singapore to the U.S., learning at their convenience.

faq.question: Do I get a certificate after completing the course?
faq.answer: Yes. You'll receive a graded performance-based certificate from the Nathaniel School of Music after completing your semester. It reflects your progress in technique, theory, rhythm, and performance.

faq.question: How much time should I practice every week?
faq.answer: We recommend at least 30 minutes a day or 3–4 hours a week to see steady progress. Each class includes practical exercises, chord work, and rhythm drills that you can build upon at home.

faq.question: Can I continue learning after the Foundation Course?
faq.answer: Absolutely. You can move into our advanced Music Method modules where you'll learn performance repertoire, improvisation, and stage collaboration with other musicians.

faq.question: What styles of music will I learn?
faq.answer: You'll explore Blues, Gospel, Pop, Rock, Bollywood, and Indian Ragas, so you can perform in multiple styles confidently. Each concept is linked to real songs and rhythm patterns for practical use.

faq.question: Will I get to showcase my performance somewhere?
faq.answer: Yes! We organize jamming sessions and bootcamps where students get the chance to perform in front of others. We also feature our students' performances on our Instagram page. You can check out some of these performances here: https://www.instagram.com/nathanielschool/

faq.question: Do I get a demo session before enrolling or joining the class?
faq.answer: We don't offer free demo sessions before enrollment. However, you can explore our teaching style and class structure from our YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCI37YB3l21oq_sLoc92YfA?sub_confirmation=1 or the free tutorials on our website - https://www.nathanielschool.com/free-tutorials. These will give you a good idea of what our classes are like and the kind of learning experience you can expect.

faq.question: What's the learning approach in the Piano Foundation Course?
faq.answer: We start from the absolute fundamentals, from understanding the piano keys to correct posture. From the very first class, students learn to play with both hands. Our lessons are not limited to one genre or key. Students explore a variety of musical styles and practice in different keys, helping them become versatile pianists. By the end of the course, every student is trained to perform both as a solo pianist and as an accompanist. We also encourage students to suggest songs they would like to learn, making the experience more personal and relevant.
